ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello

Class OthelloBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello.OthelloBoard

  • public class OthelloBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Keep track of all of the tokens on the board. This understands some interesting things about an Othello board, what the board looks like at the start of the game, what the players tokens look like ('X' and 'O'), whether given coordinates are on the board, whether either of the players have a move somewhere on the board, what happens when a player makes a move at a specific location (the opposite players tokens are flipped). Othello makes use of the OthelloBoard.
    Author:
    arnold

        public static char otherPlayer(char player)
        Parameters:
        player - either P1 or P2
        Returns:

      • get

        public char get(int row,
                int col)
        Parameters:
        row - starting row, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
        col - starting col, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
        Returns:
        P1,P2 or EMPTY, EMPTY is returned for an invalid (row,col)

      • hasMove

        public char hasMove()
        Returns:
        whether P1,P2 or BOTH have a move somewhere on the board, EMPTY if neither do.

      • move

        public boolean move(int row,
                    int col,
                    char player)
        Make a move for player at position (row,col) according to Othello rules, * making appropriate modifications to the board. Nothing is changed if this is * not a valid move.
        Parameters:
        row - starting row, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
        col - starting col, in {0,...,dim-1} (typically {0,...,7})
        player - P1 or P2
        Returns:
        true if player moved successfully at (row,col), false otherwise

      • getCount

        public int getCount(char player)
        Parameters:
        player - P1 or P2
        Returns:
        the number of tokens on the board for player

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this, just the play area, with no additional information. DO NOT MODIFY THIS!!

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        A quick test of OthelloBoard. Output is on assignment page.
        Parameters:
        args -
